address: Xã Ia Tul, Huyện Ia Pa, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**Analyzing the Administrative Restructuring of "Xã Ia Tul"**

Okay, so I'm tackling this address: "Xã Ia Tul, Huyện Ia Pa, Tỉnh Gia Lai".  My task is to pinpoint the *new* administrative unit it's been assigned to, given that we're eliminating districts.

First, I identified the key pieces: "Xã Ia Tul" (the old ward), "Tỉnh Gia Lai" (the old province), and "Huyện Ia Pa" (the old district, though it's less critical given the "eliminating all districts" constraint).

Next, I dove into the relevant resolutions. Resolution "60-NQ/TW" confirms that "Tỉnh Gia Lai" stays "Tỉnh Gia Lai" after any potential mergers. So, the province won't be changing.

Then, I focused on "1664/NQ-UBTVQH15", the key resolution for restructuring in Gia Lai. I combed through it, looking for any mention of "Xã Ia Tul". Bingo! Line 81 explicitly states that "Xã Ia Tul" *merges with other wards* to form a *new* ward, also named "Xã Ia Tul". That's a strong indicator.

I then scanned the "New Wards" data.  I was looking for a new "Xã Ia Tul" within Gia Lai, and there it was: code "24028", name "Xã Ia Tul", in "Tỉnh Gia Lai". This directly matches my findings in the resolution.

Finally, I checked "1676/NQ-UBTVQH15" but realized that was for a different province and disregarded it.

The old "Xã Ia Tul" is clearly part of the new "Xã Ia Tul" (code 24028). The province stays the same, "Tỉnh Gia Lai". I'm confident in this because I found direct mention of the ward, it being part of the new same name ward and the matching entry in the provided new wards list. My analysis is complete.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 81. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Chư Mố, Ia Broăi, Ia Kdăm và Ia Tul thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Ia Tul.
